content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a hotel in Hokkaido for the period March 1 to March 7, 2024, with a rating of 9+, check out its user reviews, which categories are greater than 9 and which are less than 9?  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first step is to enter the destination, "Hokkaido," in the search box to start searching for hotels in that region. The proper textbox for this is element [14].
Action: Type [14]; Hokkaido
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently showing September and October 2025. To select the correct dates (March 1 to March 7, 2024), I need to navigate back several months in the calendar. There is no visible "previous month" button, but there is a "next month" button ([18]). Scrolling or searching for a way to go to previous months is needed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible calendar is currently displaying dates for September and October 2025. We need dates for March 1 to March 7, 2024. Since only a "Next month" button ([18]) is visible, scrolling will not help. I need to look for any navigation control (such as an arrow or a button) that allows going to previous months, which is not visible. It's likely the control is offscreen to the left; I should try scrolling horizontally to the left.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; left
Confidence: 0.6
Completion: 0.15
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: There is currently no visible option to go to previous months, only a "Next month" button ([18]) is shown. Since the required months are not visible, and there is no left navigation, I should try clicking on the "Check-in date — Check-out date" button ([15]) again, as this might bring up more calendar options or a way to rapidly change the year/month.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search has reset, and the calendar is not open. I need to select the check-in and check-out dates again. By clicking the "Check-in date — Check-out date" button ([15]), the date selection calendar will likely pop up where I can navigate to March 2024.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is once again open and displaying September and October 2025. I need to select March 2024, which requires navigating several months back. There is no visible "previous month" button. The "Next month" button ([18]) is available and usually such calendars allow for continuous clicking to eventually cycle back to earlier years/months, but sometimes calendars only allow moving forward. Since the previous month navigation is not visible, I need to look for another way to jump back, such as clicking on the month/year heading. However, these options are not evident, so as the next best attempt, I will check if clicking the "Calendar" button ([16]) gives alternate navigation options.
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 0.7
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clicking "Calendar" did not provide a new way to navigate the months or quickly jump to March 2024. The only visible navigation option is the "Next month" button ([18]), with no "previous" or "year/month dropdown" option. I should try clicking the "Exact dates" button ([89]) at the bottom of the calendar, which may allow manual entry of dates or quicker navigation to the correct year/month.
Action: Click [89]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Exact dates" button ([89]) did not bring up a manual date entry field or alternate calendar view. There is still no apparent way to go back to earlier months/years. The only visible control is "Next month" ([18]), which will not help. I need to look for another possible area for navigation or a hidden/scrollable option. Before giving up, I'll click the "Check-in date — Check-out date" button ([15]) again in case it resets or allows another way to select dates.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.6
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now closed and the search results are shown for Hokkaido, but the date is still not set to March 1 to March 7, 2024. I need to set the correct dates before applying any rating or other filters. Clicking the "Check-in date — Check-out date" button ([15]) should open the calendar to try setting the correct dates again.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is again open, but it's stuck in September/October 2025, with only a "Next month" button available. There is no visible way to navigate to earlier months or years, which is required for selecting March 2024. None of the tested buttons offer manual date entry or a jump to a previous year. Considering this, it is possible that either user input for date is handled differently (e.g., via a settings menu or a hidden clickable area on the calendar header), or there is a UI issue. Before abandoning, I will try clicking the displayed month/year header (above calendar) to attempt a jump to the year/month selection, as sometimes calendar widgets support this.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.6
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Previous month" button ([18]) is now visible, which allows navigating back to earlier dates. To get to March 2024, I must keep clicking "Previous month" ([18]) until the calendar reaches March 2024.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Previous month" button ([18]) has successfully appeared, and I need to keep clicking it repeatedly to navigate back from September 2025 toward March 2024 (the required check-in and check-out month). Since each click moves one month back, several more clicks will be needed.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.27
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still seeing the calendar for October and November 2025. To reach March 2024, I need to keep clicking the "Previous month" button ([18]) multiple times to go back further.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.28
